concept_data.title: International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes

summary: The International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes (ICSID) is a pivotal institution established under the auspices of the World Bank to facilitate the resolution of investment disputes between states and foreign investors. Within the EU legal framework, ICSID plays a crucial role in promoting investment protection and fostering a stable investment climate. The Centre provides arbitration and conciliation services, ensuring that disputes are settled in accordance with international law principles. Its relevance is underscored by the EU's commitment to uphold the rule of law and protect investors' rights, thereby enhancing legal certainty and fostering economic cooperation among member states and third countries.
